security_audit.summary: Documentation-only content with code examples and references. No executable scripts, tool calls, or data access patterns. No indicators of data theft or malicious execution.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS configs with confidence
content.value_statement: You need fast, accurate guidance for Payload CMS configuration and APIs. This skill provides curated patterns and examples for collections, fields, hooks, queries, access control, plugins, and adapters.
actual_capabilities: Explain collection configurations including auth, uploads, drafts, and live preview
Provide field type patterns, validation, and admin UI examples
Guide access control rules with boolean and query constraints
Describe hooks, context usage, and transaction safe operations
Outline plugin architecture, package structure, and endpoints
Reference adapter setup for databases, storage, and email
limitations: Does not execute code or access your project files
Does not validate against your schema or database
Requires you to provide your Payload version and context
Cannot perform deployments or server configuration

prompt_templates.title: Start a collection
prompt_templates.scenario: New Payload project with blog posts
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Posts collection with title, slug, author, content, and draft support. Include admin defaults and timestamps.

prompt_templates.title: Add access rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Write access control for posts so public can read published, users can edit their own, and admins can edit all.

prompt_templates.title: Use hooks safely
prompt_templates.prompt: Show beforeChange and afterChange hooks that set slug and create an audit log using transaction safe req passing.

prompt_templates.title: Build a plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a plugin that adds a meta group field to selected collections and preserves existing hooks.

output_examples.input: How should I enforce access control in local API calls for a logged in user?
output: Set overrideAccess to false when you pass a user to local API calls
Explain that overrideAccess defaults to true and bypasses permissions
Recommend using query constraints for row level access

best_practices: Pass req through nested operations to preserve transactions
Use boolean access checks for fields and query constraints for collections
Keep plugin functions pure and return the modified config
anti_patterns: Passing user without overrideAccess in local API operations
Mutating data in hooks without returning the updated object
Adding plugin hooks without preserving existing arrays

faq.question: Is this compatible with Payload 3.x?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance targets Payload 3.x patterns and Next.js integration.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples but cannot run code or validate your project.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing Payload projects?
faq.answer: Yes, use it to compare your configs with recommended patterns and fix issues.

faq.question: Does it access my data or environment variables?
faq.answer: No, it only provides documentation based guidance and examples.

faq.question: What if my issue persists after changes?
faq.answer: Share your config and errors so the guidance can be refined for your case.

faq.question: How does it compare to general coding assistants?
faq.answer: It is specialized for Payload CMS patterns, reducing guesswork and setup errors.
